name: Stylish / Stylus Dark (Chrome Plugin) v1.2
description: Make the actual Stylish / Stylus plugin itself dark! (Chrome Only - see info section!)
additional_info:
One of the most common uses for Stylish & Stylus is to re-theme web pages to make them darker, but ironically the plugins themselves are all white flash-bangs. Well no more! Since I wanted it to look nice and dark by default, there are some CodeMirror theme overrides to this effect. But then again if you're using the CodeMirror (the Edit script page) then you should have no problem commenting out those style overrides if it clashes with your preferred CodeMirror theme. :)
Click the links below to see screenshots: New: Stylus Manage page. Stylish Manage page. Stylish Script Editor. Stylish-icon menu. This is for the Stylish / Stylus Chrome plugins only and matches on the "chrome-extension:" URL. Other plugins will be unaffected. How does that work? The answer is here on the forum. v1.1: Updated to also restyle the Stylish plugin icon menu window. v1.2: Icon menu "style-name" container changed from label to div in new version of Stylish.  Stylish Dark css updated to work with both the old and new version. update: Tested and working in Stylus.
